# Introduction  {.tabset .tabset-fade .tabset-pills}

The goal of this competition is to build classification models to predict depression.

My notebook serves as a demonstration of some of the possible techniques available to arrive at a solution.  I intend to add to this as I have time available. Your questions and comments are welcome.

If you fork this on kaggle, be sure to choose the kernel Environment setting for "Always use latest environment"

Lets dive right in.

The Kaggle kernels have many of the common r packages built in.

In addition to `tidymodels` we will load the `bonsai` interface to lightgbm.


## Load Data

```{r }
#| label: load data
#| warning: false
#| message: false


train_spec <- cols(
  id = col_double(),
  Name = col_character(),
  Gender = col_character(),
  Age = col_double(),
  City = col_character(),
  `Working Professional or Student` = col_character(),
  Profession = col_character(),
  `Academic Pressure` = col_character(),
  `Work Pressure` = col_character(),
  CGPA = col_double(),
  `Study Satisfaction` = col_character(),
  `Job Satisfaction` = col_character(),
  `Sleep Duration` = col_character(),
  `Dietary Habits` = col_character(),
  Degree = col_character(),
  `Have you ever had suicidal thoughts ?` = col_character(),
  `Work/Study Hours` = col_double(),
  `Financial Stress` = col_character(),
  `Family History of Mental Illness` = col_character(),
  Depression = readr::col_factor()
)


competition_spec <- cols(
  id = col_double(),
  Name = col_character(),
  Gender = col_character(),
  Age = col_double(),
  City = col_character(),
  `Working Professional or Student` = col_character(),
  Profession = col_character(),
  `Academic Pressure` = col_character(),
  `Work Pressure` = col_character(),
  CGPA = col_double(),
  `Study Satisfaction` = col_character(),
  `Job Satisfaction` = col_character(),
  `Sleep Duration` = col_character(),
  `Dietary Habits` = col_character(),
  Degree = col_character(),
  `Have you ever had suicidal thoughts ?` = col_character(),
  `Work/Study Hours` = col_double(),
  `Financial Stress` = col_character(),
  `Family History of Mental Illness` = col_character()
)


preprocessor <- function(dataframe) {

dataframe <- dataframe %>%
    janitor::clean_names() %>%
    
    mutate(across(c(where(is.numeric), -id), ~ as.factor(.x), .names = "factor_{.col}")) |>
    
    mutate(across(c(where(is.character)), ~ as.factor(.x))) 


return(dataframe)
}

raw_df <- read_csv(str_c(path, "train.csv"),
                   col_types = train_spec,
                   show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
          preprocessor() 

tst_df <- read_csv(str_c(path, "test.csv"),
                   col_types = competition_spec,
                   show_col_types = FALSE)  %>% 
  preprocessor() 

all_df <-
    bind_rows(raw_df %>% mutate(source = "train"),
              tst_df %>% mutate(source = "test"))

train_df <- all_df %>% 
  filter(source == "train") %>% 
  select(-source) 

competition_df <- all_df %>% 
  filter(source == "test") %>% 
  select(-source, -depression)

features <- train_df %>%
  select(-id, -depression) %>%
  names()

train_df <- train_df %>% 
  distinct(pick(all_of(features)), .keep_all = TRUE)

nom_features <- train_df %>%
  select(all_of(features)) %>%
  select(where(is.character), where(is.factor)) %>%
  names() 

logical_features <- train_df %>%
  select(all_of(features)) %>%
  select(where(is.logical)) %>%
  names() 

num_features <- train_df %>%
  select(all_of(features)) %>%
  select(where(is.numeric)) %>%
  names()


```

Nominal features:

`r nom_features`

Numeric features: 

`r num_features`

Logical features: 

`r logical_features`


Size of the combined train and competition datasets:

`r nrow(all_df)`

Size of the split made available to machine learning

`r nrow(train_df)`

# Machine Learning {.tabset .tabset-fade .tabset-pills}


## Recipe

```{r}
#| label: recipe
                   
rec <- recipe(
    
    formula(paste0("depression ~ ", 
               str_c(features,  collapse = " + "))),
    data = train_df
  ) %>% 

  step_novel(all_nominal_predictors()) 
                   
folds <- vfold_cv(train_df, 
                  v = 6,
                  repeats = 1,
                  strata = depression)    
                   
ctrl <- stacks::control_stack_grid()                                
                                     
```

## Lightgbm

```{r}
#| label: lgbm
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| fig.width: 12

boost_tree_lgbm_spec <- 
  boost_tree(
    trees = 1e2L,
   tree_depth = tune(),
   learn_rate =  tune(),
   min_n = tune(),
#   mtry = tune(),
   loss_reduction = 0
  ) %>% 
  set_engine(engine = "lightgbm",
             is_unbalance = TRUE,
             num_leaves = tune(),
             num_threads = cores
       #      boosting = "goss"   # this may slow the runtime
             ) %>%
  set_mode(mode = "classification") 
                   
wf <- workflow(rec,
               boost_tree_lgbm_spec) 

param <- wf %>%
   extract_parameter_set_dials() %>%
   recipes::update(
      min_n = min_n(range = c(10,90)),
      tree_depth = tree_depth(range = c(4,40)),
      learn_rate = learn_rate(range = c(-2,-1)),
      num_leaves = num_leaves(range = c(700,1000))
   ) %>%
   dials::finalize(raw_df)                 

lgbm_rs <- tune_grid(
  wf,
  grid = 25,
  resamples = folds,
  control = ctrl,
  metrics = metric_set(mn_log_loss, accuracy),
  param_info = param)

show_best(lgbm_rs, metric = "mn_log_loss")  

autoplot(lgbm_rs)

collect_metrics(lgbm_rs) %>% 
  filter(.metric == "mn_log_loss") %>% 
  mutate(.config = fct_reorder(.config, mean)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(mean, .config)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_errorbarh(aes(xmin = mean - std_err, xmax = mean + std_err)) +
  labs(title = "Mean Log Loss across resample folds with std_err")
                   

```

# Importance
```{r }                   
#| label: importance
#| warning: false
#| message: false
                   
best_accuracy <-   select_best(lgbm_rs, metric = "accuracy")                 
                   
final_lgbm <- wf %>%
    finalize_workflow(best_accuracy) 
                  
classification_fit <- final_lgbm %>%
                        fit(train_df) 

classification_fit |> 
  extract_fit_engine() |> 
  lgb.importance() |> 
  as_tibble() %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = Gain, y = fct_reorder(Feature, Gain))) +
  geom_col() +
  labs(title = "Feature Importance", x = "Gain", y = NULL, caption = "LightGBM Model | Visual: Jim Gruman")                    
                    
```
                   
# Submission
                   
